title: As someone on the west coast..
body:
Who is going to go from 30 ping to 90 ping (probably the same ping EC were complaining about all that time) on August 25th
Your "central" server is not central

replies.body: Chicago also pleases some canadian players as well ;)
I actually was disappointed that it wasn't closer to me until I remembered that the NA region includes Canada. And then I decided that Chicago would probably be better all-around.

Most of the ping complaints I saw from east-coasters were in the 110-140 range.

Going up to 90 puts you about where I've been all this time - and I live in Oklahoma.
If you look at the internet backbone, the only other place would be Texas, and Texas is at the very bottom of the United States.
Right now I am on the East coast, Virginia specifically. My ping hadn't change a lot since the server moved. 90 to 85 or 80 at least.

The servers havent even moved yet. They arent moving until august 25th. So whatever youre talking about has nothing to do with the servers cuz theyre still in the place theyve always been until the 25th

I didn't expect someone to take the bait but K~  http://images6.fanpop.com/image/photos/36200000/Ahri-image-ahri-36281940-100-100.png http://images6.fanpop.com/image/photos/36200000/Ahri-image-ahri-36281940-100-100.png
would explain why hes ping hasn't changed ;) ahahaha
Well, technically speaking.. It IS in the CENTRAL time zone!

Geographical center is not necessarily the center of the internet network. 

It sounds to me like you're going to want to make sure your ISP is on that PoP list they keep talking about, because your taking a very long way around to get to Chicago.
